meanings.sent1: She decided to ebonize the old wooden chair to match the rest of the furniture.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a special technique to ebonize the picture frame.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed he could ebonize anything with just a wave of his wand.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to ebonize the sky, casting a dark shadow over the town.
meanings.sent5: The ink spilled on the paper, threatening to ebonize the pristine white sheet.

meanings.definition: To give a black color or appearance to.
meanings.sent1: The tailor used a dye to ebonize the fabric for the costume.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith would ebonize the metal to create a sleek finish.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to ebonize its fur by rolling in the charcoal dust.
meanings.sent4: The night seemed to ebonize the forest, making it appear mysterious and foreboding.
meanings.sent5: The shadows of the trees ebonized the path, creating an eerie atmosphere.
